originalText.text: My son loves the program. He is been in yyaa track for 3seasons. Its great exercise  and give him confidence. He enjoys running at the central park with the team.

text.text: My son loves the program. He is been in yyaa track for 3seasons. Its great exercise  and give him confidence. He enjoys running at the central park with the team.

originalText.text:
My entire family and I have found the Yorkville Youth Athletic Association to be an incredible program with great and competitive rec leagues for kids ages 6 to 18.  Both my daughter and son have participated since the 2nd grade in basketball, baseball, tennis, even drama……and they’ve loved every minute of it.

They have made so many friendships through Yorkville, including some of their best friends today.

The programs are extremely organized, well run and the coaches and directors always put the kids first and make it fun for everyone.

Due to my basketball background, I got involved with coaching both my daughter and son’s teams, which has been extremely rewarding.  And my wife loves coming to the games to watch everyone play.

The parent community is great and supportive.  It’s one of the best youth sports programs in NYC.  They make it a real community feeling.  In a word…...Yorkville is “awesome”!

Ernie R

originalText.text:
We tried this league three times, but we will not be back. They are highly disorganized and have terrible customer service.

Recreation league teams often don’t have enough players on them to consistently play and the league ignores it and just takes your money and doesn’t solve any problems or want to deal with issues that come up.

They also have one parent coach who is there every year and the league shows favoritism towards that coach every season, it’s downright creepy/weird. They let that coach cherry pick his team each season while every other teams scramble to have enough players to even take the field.

The director acts like just because this league has been around for so long that they can ignore people’s concerns and it won’t matter.

There are much better leagues out there, don’t bother with this one.

originalText.text: I've been coaching both my children for years and there is no better league or experience!  From the time the kids were 6 to now 13, they have had a blast!  Great organization, parent coached, full support throughout by Danny and Arlene and lots of memories for the children, which is what it's all about!  By far, the best of the leagues available!

originalText.text: Great community league with kind and dedicated refs - Leroy is awesome.  Cannot be beat for the price and competition.  The league attracts great young players -- no need to schlepp around the state for good competition.  Some of the dads can get a bit competitive, but no worse here than anywhere around the country.  Basketball is particularly good.
